jobs.title: Data Analyst for Product Growth
jobs.description:
### **As a Data Analyst for Product Growth, you will**

- Lead all things data for a growth team in our Product organization
- Identify the drivers of activation, monetization, and engagement
- Analyze large, rich data sets
- Improve our product which helps 100,000+ developers build and deliver software faster

### **About Product Growth Analytics at CircleCI**

You will be a member of CircleCI's data science and analytics team reporting to our director. The data science and analytics team is focused on improving our product experience and building a data-driven product culture.

You will be embedded into CircleCI's growth practice. The growth practice is four teams spanning Product and Engineering. Each growth team is led by a product manager and supported by an analytics lead (that’s you!).

Growth teams deliver measurable improvements to our product experience. To do so, they collaborate across CircleCI’s entire organization, including product, design, and marketing as well as application and data engineering.

### **What you’ll do:**

- **Be a brilliant analyst:** Turn business problems into research plans. Leverage data from the data lake, data warehouse, third parties, and source systems. Work confidently with clean and messy data. Aggregate, clean, and explore. Soundly use statistics and probability. Tell compelling stories. Build impactful visualizations. Present insights to peers and executives. Drive action and outcomes. Turn repetitive analyses into dashboards.
- **Lead analytics for a product team:** Partner with product managers. Brainstorm ideas, experiments, hypotheses, and roadmaps. Collaborate to fully understand context, needs, vision, and outcomes. Ask smart questions. Set team goals. Define, document, monitor and forecast KPI. Perform root cause analyses on key metrics. Define requirements for developers to improve data instrumentation.
- **Understand our product and customers:** Analyze product features, journeys, and life cycles. Drive conversion, engagement, and efficiency across our funnel. Focus on activation, monetization, engagement, and retention. Identify customer characteristics and behaviors. Improve segmenting and cohorting.
- **Leverage a growth toolkit** : Define the models, paths, and loops of growth. Identify and prioritize opportunities for incremental improvements. Work in cycles of build, measure, and learn. Define, implement, and interpret A/B tests and other experiments. Educate stakeholders on statistical validity. 
- **Build a growth practice:** Scale success. Celebrate fast failure. Mature from one-off tactics to repeatable processes. Define best practices. Embrace not just quantitative, but qualitative; not just analytics, but creative thinking. Define requirements for data engineering to improve data, automation and analytics capabilities. 

### **What we're looking for:**

- **Three years of analytics experience:** At least three years of analytics experience. Prior experience in an analytics role specifically focused on product or growth is highly preferred
- **Experience at a high-growth company:** Analytics experience with high-growth businesses. Ideally, those with well-defined, product-enabled funnels and complex, high-volume customer flows.
- **Technical education:** A bachelor’s degree in a technical or quantitative field (e.g., Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, Economics, or Finance).
- **Proficiency across analytics tools:** Deep experience with analytical SQL queries (e.g., inner/left/right joins, CTEs, and window functions). Some experience with scripting within a notebook environment, preferably using Python, Pandas and Jupyter. A desire to grow your modeling, machine-learning, and data-science skills. Familiarity with basic statistics (e.g., distributions, experiments, significance testing, and linear regression).  Experience with a major analytics/visualization platform (e.g., Tableau or Looker). 
- **Proficiency across growth tools:** Productive with growth tools. Specifically a product or events analytics platform (e.g., Google Analytics, Amplitude or Segment) and an AB testing tool (e.g., Optimizely or  VWO).
- **Right soft skills:** Passion for data, discovery, and problem-solving. Curious; confident; open to questioning assumptions and being questioned. Effective communicator across technical and business audiences.  Able to manage stakeholder expectations and work with hands-on executives. Entrepreneurial; fast-moving; able to balance vision and execution; and not easily discouraged. Instinct for value, and focused on the incremental.

You can work remotely anywhere in North America. You also have the option to work out of our San Francisco, Denver, Boston or Toronto offices. CircleCI is a distributed company with team members across 50+ cities and 13 countries.

### **How to apply**

If you’re interested in joining the team at CircleCI, please send a resumé and a cover letter if you’d like to let us know describing what inspires you and why you think you are a good fit for the team. If you contribute to an open-source project, write a blog, or have a presence on the web (GitHub, Twitter, Stack, etc.) we would love to hear about it.

We know there’s no such thing as a “perfect" candidate. We’re all a work in progress and are growing new skills and capabilities all the time. CircleCI welcomes those who are enthusiastic about learning and evolving, so however you identify and whatever your background, if this looks like a role where you could do work that excites you, we hope you’ll apply.

### **About CircleCI **

CircleCI is the world’s largest shared continuous integration and continuous delivery (CI/CD) platform, and the central hub where code moves from idea to delivery. As one of the most-used DevOps tools that processes more than 1 million builds a day, CircleCI has unique access to data on how engineering teams work, and how their code runs. Companies like Spotify, Coinbase, Stitch Fix, and BuzzFeed use us to improve engineering team productivity, release better products, and get to market faster. 

Founded in 2011 and headquartered in downtown San Francisco with a global, remote workforce, CircleCI is venture-backed by IVP, Sapphire Ventures, Owl Rock, NextEquity Partners, Scale Venture Partners, Threshold Ventures, Baseline Ventures, Top Tier Capital Partners, Industry Ventures, Heavybit, and Harrison Metal Capital. jobs.descriptionHtml:
As a Data Analyst for Product Growth, you will

  • Lead all things data for a growth team in our Product organization
  • Identify the drivers of activation, monetization, and engagement
  • Analyze large, rich data sets
  • Improve our product which helps 100,000+ developers build and deliver software faster

About Product Growth Analytics at CircleCI

You will be a member of CircleCI's data science and analytics team reporting to our director. The data science and analytics team is focused on improving our product experience and building a data-driven product culture.

You will be embedded into CircleCI's growth practice. The growth practice is four teams spanning Product and Engineering. Each growth team is led by a product manager and supported by an analytics lead (that’s you!).

Growth teams deliver measurable improvements to our product experience. To do so, they collaborate across CircleCI’s entire organization, including product, design, and marketing as well as application and data engineering.

What you’ll do:

  • Be a brilliant analyst: Turn business problems into research plans. Leverage data from the data lake, data warehouse, third parties, and source systems. Work confidently with clean and messy data. Aggregate, clean, and explore. Soundly use statistics and probability. Tell compelling stories. Build impactful visualizations. Present insights to peers and executives. Drive action and outcomes. Turn repetitive analyses into dashboards.
  • Lead analytics for a product team: Partner with product managers. Brainstorm ideas, experiments, hypotheses, and roadmaps. Collaborate to fully understand context, needs, vision, and outcomes. Ask smart questions. Set team goals. Define, document, monitor and forecast KPI. Perform root cause analyses on key metrics. Define requirements for developers to improve data instrumentation.
  • Understand our product and customers: Analyze product features, journeys, and life cycles. Drive conversion, engagement, and efficiency across our funnel. Focus on activation, monetization, engagement, and retention. Identify customer characteristics and behaviors. Improve segmenting and cohorting.
  • Leverage a growth toolkit : Define the models, paths, and loops of growth. Identify and prioritize opportunities for incremental improvements. Work in cycles of build, measure, and learn. Define, implement, and interpret A/B tests and other experiments. Educate stakeholders on statistical validity.
  • Build a growth practice: Scale success. Celebrate fast failure. Mature from one-off tactics to repeatable processes. Define best practices. Embrace not just quantitative, but qualitative; not just analytics, but creative thinking. Define requirements for data engineering to improve data, automation and analytics capabilities.

What we're looking for:

  • Three years of analytics experience: At least three years of analytics experience. Prior experience in an analytics role specifically focused on product or growth is highly preferred
  • Experience at a high-growth company: Analytics experience with high-growth businesses. Ideally, those with well-defined, product-enabled funnels and complex, high-volume customer flows.
  • Technical education: A bachelor’s degree in a technical or quantitative field (e.g., Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, Economics, or Finance).
  • Proficiency across analytics tools: Deep experience with analytical SQL queries (e.g., inner/left/right joins, CTEs, and window functions). Some experience with scripting within a notebook environment, preferably using Python, Pandas and Jupyter. A desire to grow your modeling, machine-learning, and data-science skills. Familiarity with basic statistics (e.g., distributions, experiments, significance testing, and linear regression). Experience with a major analytics/visualization platform (e.g., Tableau or Looker).
  • Proficiency across growth tools: Productive with growth tools. Specifically a product or events analytics platform (e.g., Google Analytics, Amplitude or Segment) and an AB testing tool (e.g., Optimizely or VWO).
  • Right soft skills: Passion for data, discovery, and problem-solving. Curious; confident; open to questioning assumptions and being questioned. Effective communicator across technical and business audiences. Able to manage stakeholder expectations and work with hands-on executives. Entrepreneurial; fast-moving; able to balance vision and execution; and not easily discouraged. Instinct for value, and focused on the incremental.

You can work remotely anywhere in North America. You also have the option to work out of our San Francisco, Denver, Boston or Toronto offices. CircleCI is a distributed company with team members across 50+ cities and 13 countries.

How to apply

If you’re interested in joining the team at CircleCI, please send a resumé and a cover letter if you’d like to let us know describing what inspires you and why you think you are a good fit for the team. If you contribute to an open-source project, write a blog, or have a presence on the web (GitHub, Twitter, Stack, etc.) we would love to hear about it.

We know there’s no such thing as a “perfect" candidate. We’re all a work in progress and are growing new skills and capabilities all the time. CircleCI welcomes those who are enthusiastic about learning and evolving, so however you identify and whatever your background, if this looks like a role where you could do work that excites you, we hope you’ll apply.

jobs.title: Director of Product Management
jobs.description:
**As the Director of Product Management at CircleCI** , you will lead and mentor a product management team that works closely with Engineering, Design and Marketing to create an intuitive, cohesive and delightful customer experience for users across all CircleCI products and platforms. 

### **About Product Management at CircleCI:**

The Product Management team is responsible for the product strategy and roadmap, and execution and delivery. Because developers are our customers (and we’re a huge user of our own service), Product Management and Engineering work together closely to understand the needs of our users, and jointly define the product vision. We work in cross-functional teams, use data and user-research to drive our decision making, believe in delivering features quickly and continuously improving them, and love to talk to our users. We prioritize work that delivers the most impact, and is measurable and achievable.

### **What you’ll do:**

- Lead multiple product management teams and align the talent, tools, and processes with the business goals. 
- Define the product strategy for your area of ownership, develop and identify the key measures of success, set expectations with all relevant stakeholders, and effectively prioritize across initiatives, teams and functions
- Coach product managers as they break down complex problems, develop strategies and plans to solve them, and help them collaborate to deliver solutions
- Use your knowledge of best practices to direct product management teams across the full product life cycle, from user research to requirements refinement to prototyping to production and ultimately sunset
- Practice a highly efficient, iterative product management process with an eye for continuous improvement 
- Ability to roll-up your sleeves and rapidly develop opportunity assessments, product briefs, user stories, etc. if necessary
- Attract, inspire, mentor, and grow top product management talent

### **What we're looking for:****  **

- 8+ years direct product management experience
- 4+ years of experience leading a team of product managers
- Ability to mentor product managers, engineers and/or designers in how to work together to build great products
- Ability to lead the product management of large, complex systems of interactions across a multitude of touchpoints - web, mobile, API, CLI, etc.
- Ability to quickly grasp and distill highly complex business needs and user issues into clean, understandable solutions
- Ability to lead, coach, inspire, and motivate a team to create and deliver truly remarkable work
- Ability to attract and recruit exceptional talent
- Ability to communicate effectively with and influence different audiences
- Work experience in start-ups or evidence you thrive in a fast-paced environment
- Experience working in Agile and/or Lean environments
- Knowledge of current trends in product management, best practices, and processes
- Strong communication and organizational skills
- Bachelor’s Degree preferred

### How to apply

If you’re interested in joining the team at CircleCI, please send a resumé and cover letter describing what inspires you and why you think you are a good fit for the team. If you contribute to an open source project, write a blog, or have a presence on the web (GitHub, Twitter, Stack, etc.) we would love to hear about it.

We know there’s no such thing as a “perfect" candidate - we’re all a work in progress and are growing new skills and capabilities all the time. CircleCI welcomes those who are enthusiastic about learning and evolving, so however you identify and whatever your background, if this looks like a role where you could do work that excites you, we hope you’ll apply.

### **About CircleCI **

CircleCI is the world’s largest shared continuous integration and continuous delivery (CI/CD) platform, and the central hub where code moves from idea to delivery. As one of the most-used DevOps tools that processes more than 1 million builds a day, CircleCI has unique access to data on how engineering teams work, and how their code runs. Companies like Spotify, Coinbase, Stitch Fix, and BuzzFeed use us to improve engineering team productivity, release better products, and get to market faster. 

Founded in 2011 and headquartered in downtown San Francisco with a global, remote workforce, CircleCI is venture-backed by IVP, Sapphire Ventures, Owl Rock, NextEquity Partners, Scale Venture Partners, Threshold Ventures, Baseline Ventures, Top Tier Capital Partners, Industry Ventures, Heavybit, and Harrison Metal Capital. Learn more at [https://circleci.com](https://circleci.com/).

CircleCI is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, sexual stereotypes, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law.

jobs.title: Engineering Manager - Ecosystem Team
jobs.description:
At CircleCI, we enable thousands of developers to do better work every day. We're looking for an Engineering Manager to support and grow the people who make that possible.

The Ecosystem team’s goal is expanding the use of our platform through private and shared extensions. They are also responsible for [Orbs](https://circleci.com/docs/2.0/using-orbs/) and our [CLI](https://circleci.com/docs/2.0/local-cli/).

As the manager for this cross-functional team, you’ll collaborate daily with 4-8 engineers distributed across North America and Western Europe. You’ll report to a Senior Engineering Manager in our Product Engineering organization.

This is a full-time role in Canada, hired through our affiliate Continuous Labs. 

### **What You’ll Do: **

- **Plan and align: You’ll collaborate with engineering leadership, product managers, and your team to define longterm strategic initiatives, quarterly Objectives and Key Results (OKRs), feature roadmaps, and weekly priorities. You’ll help the team set technical direction congruent with company vision.**
- **Help the team deliver user value:** You’ll ensure your team consistently and incrementally delivers features that provide value to our customers and our business. 
- **Foster professional growth: You’ll have direct reports with a variety of backgrounds and various levels of experience. You’ll be accountable for their performance and career growth. You’ll coach them to identify areas in our [Engineering Competency Matrix](https://circleci.com/blog/why-we-re-designed-our-engineering-career-paths-at-circleci/) where they’d like to focus their efforts, help them set goals, and provide them with regular feedback. You’ll identify challenging opportunities to keep them engaged in pursuit of our company vision. **
- **Grow the team:** You’ll participate in the hiring process from application review to onboarding.
- **Support the team:** Through service-oriented leadership, you’ll identify what the team needs in order to succeed, and ensure those needs are met within the constraints of our organization.
- **Mature and improve the team:** You’ll guide engineers to continuously improve team processes, refine best practices, and cultivate an inclusive culture.

### **What We’re Looking For:**

- At least **1 year of direct management experience** - leading a software engineering team and directly managing engineers. 
- At least **6 months of full-time experience** working transparently and collaboratively with a **fully distributed team**.
- A track record of using **agile and lean methodologies** to help teams continuously deliver user value. 
- Exceptional **written and verbal communication skills** honed for both synchronous and asynchronous collaboration.

### **Bonus Points!**

- You favor regular, **incremental progress**  **over perfection**.
- You’re excited about **scaling**  ***all***  **of our systems** --software and human.
- You strive for **continuous learning and improvement** for yourself and your team.
- You’re **good at negotiating the ambiguity** inherent in a small, rapidly-growing company: quickly adapting to change, making conscious tradeoffs when guidance is limited and information is incomplete, solving problems creatively in the face of conflicting priorities, and instituting best practices from scratch. 
- You’re **curious** and **highly organized**. You bring a knack for staying up-to-date on what's happening in the widely-distributed and fast-moving organisation around you, and you use these skills to keep your team informed.

### **You’ll find more information about Engineering Management roles at CircleCI on our blog:**

- This post contains more information about our hiring process for managers: [What we've learned about hiring engineering managers](https://circleci.com/blog/what-we-ve-learned-about-hiring-engineering-managers/)
- [What to expect as a remote CircleCI employee](https://circleci.com/blog/what-to-expect-as-a-remote-circleci-employee/)
- [How my distributed team communicates so no context is left behind](https://circleci.com/blog/how-my-distributed-team-communicates-so-no-context-is-left-behind/)

### **How to apply: **

Submit your application online via the Apply Now button. Please include a cover letter that describes why you're interested in working for CircleCI and summarize how your experience and career goals fit the qualifications for the position. 

### **About CircleCI**

CircleCI is the world’s largest shared continuous integration and continuous delivery (CI/CD) platform, and the central hub where code moves from idea to delivery. As one of the most-used DevOps tools that processes more than 1 million builds a day, CircleCI has unique access to data on how engineering teams work, and how their code runs. Companies like Spotify, Coinbase, Stitch Fix, and BuzzFeed use us to improve engineering team productivity, release better products, and get to market faster. 

CircleCI is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, sexual stereotypes, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law.

jobs.title: Engineering Manager - SRE
jobs.description:
Come help us build the world’s most reliable and fastest growing CI/CD system! Our customers range from well-known household brands to small startups and everywhere in between.  We’re growing at a furious pace and we need you to help us scale.

CircleCI is looking for an engineering leader to help us shape the future of our infrastructure and evolve our SRE practices. In this role, you’ll lead a team of engineers responsible for the infrastructure our customers use to run over 12 million builds a day. Does working with tech like Kubernetes, MongoDB, and RabbitMQ sound interesting? Do you nerd out on topics like observability, scalability, and capacity planning? If you answered yes to any of these questions we’d love to meet you!

The team you’ll lead and help grow is a talented and diverse group of engineers focused on providing a highly reliable and performant platform used by CircleCI’s product engineering teams to deliver cutting-edge features. This team is responsible for all aspects of the platform including maintenance, upgrades, automation, and new feature development.

### **What you’ll do:**

- **Support the team: You’ll collaborate with engineering leadership and key stakeholders on longer-term, strategic planning as well as seeing out the execution of those initiatives.**
- **Support engineers’ growth:** You’ll have direct reports ranging from mid-level to highly experienced engineers. You’ll be responsible for their performance and career growth. You’ll work with them to identify areas in our [Engineering Competency Matrix](https://circleci.com/blog/why-we-re-designed-our-engineering-career-paths-at-circleci/) where they’d like to focus their efforts, and support them through regular feedback, goal setting, and providing them with challenging work that drives value for our users and business. 
- **Collaborate with leaders across the organization:** You’ll work with leaders in every department - Revenue, Finance, Marketing, Product, Engineering, and more - to help solve the needs of a rapidly growing company. In this role, you’ll be reporting to our Senior Engineering Manager, SRE & Execution.
- **Learning and Development:** Attract, onboard, and retain diverse top talent. Develop people and the team through coaching, mentoring, and management support. Conduct regular 1:1s, goal setting, and feedback conversations with engineers to ensure their well-being and team health, and support them in their learning and development. Continuously work to improve inclusion and belonging on your team and throughout our organization.
- **Learning and Development:** Attract, onboard, and retain diverse top talent. Develop people and the team through coaching, mentoring, and management support. Conduct regular 1:1s, goal setting, and feedback conversations with engineers to ensure their well-being and team health, and support them in their learning and development. Continuously work to improve inclusion and belonging on your team and throughout our organization.
- **Organizational work:** Help us continuously improve and grow and build further support structures for our teams by driving broader organizational development and cross-cutting initiatives with the rest of our engineering management team.
- **Technical work:** Help grow the expertise of your team’s performance, reliability, resilience, scalability, maintainable architecture, and experimentation. We don’t expect you to write or review code on a regular basis, so this role may not be for you if you will deeply miss those things. 

### **What we're looking for:**

- **People development:** You have at least one year of experience building and leading software development or operations teams. Your experience includes hiring, supporting employee growth, and performance management.
- **Remote work:** You bring experience working with distributed teams.
- **After-hours on-call: You’re willing to provide periodic after-hours on-call support for your team.**
- **Delivery:** You are knowledgeable about modern software engineering practices and how to apply them. You believe in agile and lean values. You have a track record of using these methods in practice to continuously deliver business value.
- **Leadership:** You are a servant leader, an effective communicator and strong collaborator who emphasizes continuous learning, and you know what it takes to build strong, productive teams. You thrive on developing people and building inclusive teams.
- **Learning:** You bring action orientation and a drive to continuously improve the teams you work with.
- **Communication:** You’re an effective communicator and bring strong feedback skills to your team. You’re proficient in English in verbal and written form. 
- **NOTE:** *This role includes mandatory periodic after-hours on-call work.*

### **You’ll find information about Engineering Management roles at CircleCI on our blog:**

- [What we've learned about hiring engineering managers](https://circleci.com/blog/what-we-ve-learned-about-hiring-engineering-managers/)
- [What to expect as a remote CircleCI employee](https://circleci.com/blog/what-to-expect-as-a-remote-circleci-employee/)
- [How my distributed team communicates so no context is left behind\](https://circleci.com/blog/how-my-distributed-team-communicates-so-no-context-is-left-behind/)

### **How to apply: **

Submit your application online via the Apply Now button. Please include a cover letter that describes why you're interested in working for CircleCI and summarize how your experience and career goals fit the qualifications for the position. 

### **About CircleCI**

CircleCI is the world’s largest shared continuous integration and continuous delivery (CI/CD) platform, and the central hub where code moves from idea to delivery. As one of the most-used DevOps tools that processes more than 1 million builds a day, CircleCI has unique access to data on how engineering teams work, and how their code runs. Companies like Spotify, Coinbase, Stitch Fix, and BuzzFeed use us to improve engineering team productivity, release better products, and get to market faster.

Does working with tech like Kubernetes, MongoDB, and RabbitMQ sound interesting? Do you nerd out on topics like observability, scalability, and capacity planning? If you answered yes to any of these questions we’d love to meet you!

The team you’ll lead and help grow is a talented and diverse group of engineers focused on providing a highly reliable and performant platform used by CircleCI’s product engineering teams to deliver cutting-edge features. This team is responsible for all aspects of the platform including maintenance, upgrades, automation, and new feature development.

What you’ll do:

  • Support the team: You’ll collaborate with engineering leadership and key stakeholders on longer-term, strategic planning as well as seeing out the execution of those initiatives.
  • Support engineers’ growth: You’ll have direct reports ranging from mid-level to highly experienced engineers. You’ll be responsible for their performance and career growth. You’ll work with them to identify areas in our Engineering Competency Matrix where they’d like to focus their efforts, and support them through regular feedback, goal setting, and providing them with challenging work that drives value for our users and business.
  • Collaborate with leaders across the organization: You’ll work with leaders in every department - Revenue, Finance, Marketing, Product, Engineering, and more - to help solve the needs of a rapidly growing company. In this role, you’ll be reporting to our Senior Engineering Manager, SRE & Execution.
  • Learning and Development: Attract, onboard, and retain diverse top talent. Develop people and the team through coaching, mentoring, and management support. Conduct regular 1:1s, goal setting, and feedback conversations with engineers to ensure their well-being and team health, and support them in their learning and development. Continuously work to improve inclusion and belonging on your team and throughout our organization.
  • Learning and Development: Attract, onboard, and retain diverse top talent. Develop people and the team through coaching, mentoring, and management support. Conduct regular 1:1s, goal setting, and feedback conversations with engineers to ensure their well-being and team health, and support them in their learning and development. Continuously work to improve inclusion and belonging on your team and throughout our organization.
  • Organizational work: Help us continuously improve and grow and build further support structures for our teams by driving broader organizational development and cross-cutting initiatives with the rest of our engineering management team.
  • Technical work: Help grow the expertise of your team’s performance, reliability, resilience, scalability, maintainable architecture, and experimentation. We don’t expect you to write or review code on a regular basis, so this role may not be for you if you will deeply miss those things.

What we're looking for:

  • People development: You have at least one year of experience building and leading software development or operations teams. Your experience includes hiring, supporting employee growth, and performance management.
  • Remote work: You bring experience working with distributed teams.
  • After-hours on-call: You’re willing to provide periodic after-hours on-call support for your team.
  • Delivery: You are knowledgeable about modern software engineering practices and how to apply them. You believe in agile and lean values. You have a track record of using these methods in practice to continuously deliver business value.
  • Leadership: You are a servant leader, an effective communicator and strong collaborator who emphasizes continuous learning, and you know what it takes to build strong, productive teams. You thrive on developing people and building inclusive teams.
  • Learning: You bring action orientation and a drive to continuously improve the teams you work with.
  • Communication: You’re an effective communicator and bring strong feedback skills to your team. You’re proficient in English in verbal and written form.
  • NOTE: This role includes mandatory periodic after-hours on-call work.

You’ll find information about Engineering Management roles at CircleCI on our blog:

  • What we've learned about hiring engineering managers
  • What to expect as a remote CircleCI employee
  • [How my distributed team communicates so no context is left behind](https://circleci.com/blog/how-my-distributed-team-communicates-so-no-context-is-left-behind/)

*How to apply: *

Submit your application online via the Apply Now button. Please include a cover letter that describes why you're interested in working for CircleCI and summarize how your experience and career goals fit the qualifications for the position.

About CircleCI

CircleCI is the world’s largest shared continuous integration and continuous delivery (CI/CD) platform, and the central hub where code moves from idea to delivery. As one of the most-used DevOps tools that processes more than 1 million builds a day, CircleCI has unique access to data on how engineering teams work, and how their code runs. Companies like Spotify, Coinbase, Stitch Fix, and BuzzFeed use us to improve engineering team productivity, release better products, and get to market faster.

CircleCI is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, sexual stereotypes, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law.

jobs.title: Head of People
jobs.description:
**As the Head of People at CircleCI** , you will lead and develop global Human Resources and Recruiting functions, helping CircleCI scale its existing global presence. You will be responsible for building out the team and driving the strategy, systems and operational flows to deliver strong business impact and employee growth. The ideal candidate has both the ability to think strategically and understand the tactics we will need to execute. In this role, you will partner closely with the CFO as well as other members of the leadership team to set the vision for CircleCI’s people strategy and lead day-to-day people operations. You will incorporate an understanding of modern workforce trends (understanding of the most current tools used to manage a remote workforce a huge plus).  In addition to our other [core values](https://circleci.com/careers/), CircleCI places great importance on our Inclusive, Empathetic, and Respectful culture and sees the infusion of our values within our People strategy as critical and core to our ongoing success.

### **What you’ll do:**

HR and Recruiting

- Scale our ability to serve employee needs through technology and the right level of documentation for a globally distributed workforce
- Develop and manage a remote and in-office workplace culture with an approach that allows us to be productive from anywhere
- Define and cultivate CircleCI’s employer brand strategy 
- Help refine and scale an effective new hire onboarding program for a distributed environment to ensure that new employees can hit the ground running and be set up for long-term success
- Manage our vision, values and diversity initiatives that drive positive employee experience and involvement
- Manage HR Ops to effectively respond to employee requests, continually improve the data integrity within our HR systems and proactively address compliance requirements
- Provide input for a thoughtful and cost effective benefits program that is competitive for companies in our profile, keeping pace with compliance and workforce trends in the countries we employ people
- Extensive knowledge of compliance requirements for a globally distributed company
- Continue to architect, coach and scale exceptional Recruiting and HR teams, and enable these teams to carry out essential people functions across a rapidly growing global organization
- Develop an enhanced learning and development practice that allows employees at all levels and locations to achieve their maximum potential
- Refine and develop a high-impact performance management system
- Oversee efforts around organizational effectiveness, including organizational design, strategic consultations with group leaders, change leadership, etc. 

### **What we're looking for: **

- Senior level HR experience, able to scale operations, coach managers, and respond to wide-ranging employee incidents and/or concerns 
- Proven experience in scaling teams within a fast paced, high growth environment
- Deep understanding of change management at scale, specifically from a cultural perspective, and proactive in fostering CircleCI’s culture and values through times of high growth and ambiguity
- Strong communication skills, both written and verbal
- Proven leader, manager and mentor who knows how to grow and develop a team and their careers
- Strong business and financial acumen to see and model the current and future state of people operations
- Effective collaborator at all levels; able to lead, follow or get out of the way to inspire collaboration and execution

### How to apply

If you’re interested in joining the team at CircleCI, please send a resumé and cover letter describing what inspires you and why you think you are a good fit for the team. If you contribute to an open source project, write a blog, or have a presence on the web (GitHub, Twitter, Stack, etc.) we would love to hear about it.

We know there’s no such thing as a “perfect" candidate - we’re all a work in progress and are growing new skills and capabilities all the time. CircleCI welcomes those who are enthusiastic about learning and evolving, so however you identify and whatever your background, if this looks like a role where you could do work that excites you, we hope you’ll apply.

### **About CircleCI**

CircleCI is the world’s largest shared continuous integration and continuous delivery (CI/CD) platform, and the central hub where code moves from idea to delivery. As one of the most-used DevOps tools that processes more than 1 million builds a day, CircleCI has unique access to data on how engineering teams work, and how their code runs. Companies like Spotify, Coinbase, Stitch Fix, and BuzzFeed use us to improve engineering team productivity, release better products, and get to market faster. 

Founded in 2011 and headquartered in downtown San Francisco with a global, remote workforce, CircleCI is venture-backed by IVP, Sapphire Ventures, Owl Rock, NextEquity Partners, Scale Venture Partners, Threshold Ventures, Baseline Ventures, Top Tier Capital Partners, Industry Ventures, Heavybit, and Harrison Metal Capital. Learn more at [https://circleci.com](https://circleci.com/).

CircleCI is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, sexual stereotypes, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law.

jobs.title: Product Manager
jobs.description:
**As a Product Manager at CircleCI** , you will define and ship successful, meaningful products that help thousands of developers deliver better applications to their users faster.

### **About Product Management at CircleCI**

The Product Management team is responsible for the product strategy, roadmap, and execution. Because developers are our customers (and we’re a huge user of our own service), Product Management and Engineering work together closely to understand the needs of our users, and jointly define the product vision. We work in cross-functional teams, use data and user-research to drive our decision making, believe in delivering features quickly and continuously improving them, and love to talk to our users. We prioritize work that delivers the most impact, and is measurable and achievable.

### **What you’ll do:**

- Set the product strategy, prioritize features, build consensus and coordinate product schedules with a team of engineers and designers to ship top quality experiences to users
- Build and maintain a roadmap to delight our users while growing the business
- Build use cases and user stories and communicate them effectively
- Integrate usability studies, user research, market analysis and community feedback into product requirements to ensure the product satisfies user needs as well as wants
- Inform product decisions with quantitative data on user behavior and experimentation (a/b testing)
- Define methods and metrics for measuring success and failure while ensuring the team is clear on their objectives, and constantly track performance
- Coordinate with other product managers, designers, and engineers to ensure a cohesive overall user experience.

### **What we're looking for:****  **

- 5+ years of product management experience, ideally in SaaS or related space
- Demonstrated ability to prioritize amongst competing opportunities, balancing customer needs with business priorities and the ability to articulate the rationale behind those decisions
- Strong use of analytics, user research and business cases to drive decisions and improve products
- Exceptional written and oral communication skills
- Exceptional organizational and analytical skills
- Solid understanding of how software is built, tested and released to customers
- Experience working for an engineering-driven company a plus
- Startup experience a plus
- Understanding of Continuous Delivery concepts a plus

### **How to apply **

If you’re interested in joining the team at CircleCI, please send a resumé and cover letter describing what inspires you and why you think you are a good fit for the team. If you contribute to an open source project, write a blog, or have a presence on the web (GitHub, Twitter, Stack, etc.) we would love to hear about it.

We know there’s no such thing as a “perfect" candidate - we’re all a work in progress and are growing new skills and capabilities all the time. CircleCI welcomes those who are enthusiastic about learning and evolving, so however you identify and whatever your background, if this looks like a role where you could do work that excites you, we hope you’ll apply.

### **About CircleCI **

CircleCI is the world’s largest shared continuous integration and continuous delivery (CI/CD) platform, and the central hub where code moves from idea to delivery. As one of the most-used DevOps tools that processes more than 1 million builds a day, CircleCI has unique access to data on how engineering teams work, and how their code runs. Companies like Spotify, Coinbase, Stitch Fix, and BuzzFeed use us to improve engineering team productivity, release better products, and get to market faster. 

Founded in 2011 and headquartered in downtown San Francisco with a global, remote workforce, CircleCI is venture-backed by IVP, Sapphire Ventures, Owl Rock, NextEquity Partners, Scale Venture Partners, Threshold Ventures, Baseline Ventures, Top Tier Capital Partners, Industry Ventures, Heavybit, and Harrison Metal Capital. Learn more at [https://circleci.com](https://circleci.com/).

CircleCI is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, sexual stereotypes, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law.

jobs.title: Sales Manager, SMB
jobs.description:
**As the Sales Manager for our Small and Medium Sized Business Sales team** , you will be responsible for maximizing the current efforts of your team to prospect and close business (currently 5 Account Executives), efficiently grow headcount and productivity, and collaborate with the Global Director of Sales and other stakeholders to improve sales strategy in your market. The SMB segment is one of the most vital at CircleCI, as many customers start their journey with the platform early (Outreach.io, Procore, Acorns, Betterment, etc). 

### **What you'll do: **

- Lead and assist account executive team in identifying named accounts, establishing consistent sales practices, negotiating contracts, and ultimately closing deals
- Represent the sales team’s issues and ideas for improvement to leadership and third-party stakeholders
- Responsible for monitoring, forecasting, and achieving revenue targets for the SMB segment across the US.
- Collaborate with the sales team on the entire sales process including strategy, lead generation, product trial management, negotiation, contracting, closing, and transition to customer success
- Mentor and coach account executive team, grow their capabilities over time
- Collaborate effectively with internal partners including sales engineers and support engineers, customer success, and product managers
- Accurately track and report on sales metrics, leveraging Salesforce and Outreach.io
- Meet with prospects in the region as needed, travel approximately 15%
- Suggest and implement improvements in the sales administration process
- Use customer feedback to generate ideas about new features or products
- Ensure sales, finance, and legal policies and procedures are met
- Build a trusting, open-communication environment for your team
- Analyze regional market trends and discover new opportunities for growth

### **What we’re looking for: **

- 4+ years of technology sales experience, including 1+ years managing complex deal cycles, and 1+ years managing a team
- Ability to multi-task, prioritize, and manage time effectively 
- Passion for sales and technology
- Extensive experience leveraging Salesforce as a manager
- Experience with Sales Engagement platforms (Outreach, etc)
- Experience closing net new deals and assisting in upsell/expansion opportunities
- Excellent interpersonal and team management skills
- Skilled negotiator with a high close rate
- Preference for candidates who have experience selling technology to technologists (Dev Teams, CTOs, EAs, etc.)
- BA/BS Degree in Business, Entrepreneurship, Sales/Marketing, or Computer Science preferred

### **How to apply**

If you’re interested in joining the team at CircleCI, please send a resumé and cover letter describing what inspires you and why you think you are a good fit for the team. If you contribute to an open-source project, write a blog, or have a presence on the web (Twitter, Quora, Linkedin, etc.) we would love to hear about it.

We know there’s no such thing as a “perfect" candidate - we’re all a work in progress and are growing new skills and capabilities all the time. CircleCI welcomes those who are enthusiastic about learning and evolving, so however you identify and whatever your background, if this looks like a role where you could do work that excites you, we hope you’ll apply.

As one of the most-used DevOps tools that processes more than 1 million builds a day, CircleCI has unique access to data on how engineering teams work, and how their code runs. Companies like Spotify, Coinbase, Stitch Fix, and BuzzFeed use us to improve engineering team productivity, release better products, and get to market faster. 

Founded in 2011 and headquartered in downtown San Francisco with a global, remote workforce, CircleCI is venture-backed by IVP, Sapphire Ventures, Owl Rock, NextEquity Partners, Scale Venture Partners, Threshold Ventures, Baseline Ventures, Top Tier Capital Partners, Industry Ventures, Heavybit, and Harrison Metal Capital. jobs.title: Senior Backend Engineer - Pipelines Team
jobs.description:
At CircleCI, we enable thousands of developers to do better work every day. We're looking for a senior software engineer to help us support and grow the backend systems that make it possible.

As a member of the Pipelines team, you’ll own micro-services related to customer build configuration ([Orbs](https://circleci.com/docs/2.0/using-orbs/), for example), [pipelines](https://circleci.com/docs/2.0/pipelines/#overview), and[ job status](https://circleci.com/docs/2.0/status/). You’ll also collaborate daily with talented colleagues distributed across North America and western Europe. 

This is a full-time role in Canada, hired through our affiliate Continuous Labs and requires work during normal business hours in the Eastern time zone plus regular participation in our on-call support rotation. If you’re in the Toronto area, we hope you’ll work in our local office for some of your time.

### **What you'll do:**

- Design and build new features, simplify existing services, and scale our systems while we rapidly grow and evolve.
- Write plenty of sustainable, testable, high-quality, high-performance code.
- Nurture a culture of observability and monitoring: use operational data to help your team improve the stability and performance of our systems.
- Partner with members of a cross-functional team and other stakeholders to set the direction of our platform and product: learn about our business problems, explore solutions, weigh design tradeoffs, create effective user stories, and prioritize them to deliver maximum value.

### **What we're looking for:**

- You have 3+ years of professional experience building and debugging distributed systems in production environments.
- You write code that’s easily readable, testable, and maintainable, with an eye towards building in observability from the start.
- You’re comfortable using functional programming paradigms. (We use Clojure, but it’s fine if you haven’t yet.)   
- You’re good at managing the ambiguity of a small, rapidly-growing company: adjusting to changing priorities, making conscious tradeoffs when guidance is limited and information is incomplete, and instituting best practices from scratch when needed. 

### **We’re particularly interested in these habits and tendencies:**

- You work transparently and collaboratively within a distributed team.
- You favor regular, incremental delivery of value over perfection.
- You’re excited about ensuring that *all* of our systems--software *and* human--scale smoothly.
- You strive for continuous learning and improvement for yourself and your team.

### **How to apply**

**If you’re interested in joining the team at CircleCI, please send a resumé and a cover letter describing what inspires you and why you think you are a good fit for the team. If you contribute to an open-source project, write a blog, or have a presence on the web (GitHub, Twitter, Stack, etc.) we would love to hear about it.**

We know there’s no such thing as a “perfect” candidate - we’re all a work in progress and are growing new skills and capabilities all the time. CircleCI welcomes those who are enthusiastic about learning and evolving, so however you identify and whatever your background, if this looks like a role where you could do work that excites you, we hope you’ll apply.

### **CircleCI Engineering Competency Matrix**

This role equals level E3 on our [Engineering Competency Matrix](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1F3xzmbdsMvfDZwZesvxcEIIBn2TmI4sg/view), our internal career growth system for engineers. These are the minimum expectations for this position, but we are always willing to discuss bringing people on at more senior positions when appropriate. Find more about the matrix in this [blog post](https://circleci.com/blog/why-we-re-designed-our-engineering-career-paths-at-circleci/).

### **About CircleCI**

CircleCI is the world’s largest shared continuous integration and continuous delivery (CI/CD) platform, and the central hub where code moves from idea to delivery. As one of the most-used DevOps tools that processes more than 1 million builds a day, CircleCI has unique access to data on how engineering teams work, and how their code runs. Companies like Spotify, Coinbase, Stitch Fix, and BuzzFeed use us to improve engineering team productivity, release better products, and get to market faster. 

CircleCI is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, sexual stereotypes, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law.

This is a full-time role in Canada, hired through our affiliate Continuous Labs and requires work during normal business hours in the Eastern time zone plus regular participation in our on-call support rotation. jobs.title: Senior Data Analyst for Product Growth
jobs.description:
### **As a Senior Data Analyst for Product Growth, you will:**

- Lead all things data for a growth team in our Product organization
- Identify the drivers of activation, monetization, and engagement
- Analyze large, rich data sets
- Improve our product which helps 100,000+ developers build and deliver software faster
- Build our product and growth analytics practice

### **About Product Growth Analytics at CircleCI**

You will be a member of CircleCI's data science and analytics team reporting to our director. The data science and analytics team is focused on improving our product experience and building a data-driven product culture.

You will be embedded into CircleCI's growth practice. The growth practice is four teams spanning Product and Engineering. Each growth team is led by a product manager and supported by an analytics lead (that’s you!).

Growth teams deliver measurable improvements to our product experience. To do so, they collaborate across CircleCI’s entire organization, including product, design, and marketing as well as application and data engineering.

### **What you’ll do:**

- **Be a brilliant analyst:** Turn business problems into research plans. Leverage data from the data lake, data warehouse, third parties, and source systems. Work confidently with clean and messy data. Aggregate, clean, and explore. Soundly use statistics and probability. Tell compelling stories. Build impactful visualizations. Present insights to peers and executives. Drive action and outcomes. Turn repetitive analyses into dashboards.
- **Lead analytics for a product team:** Partner with product managers. Brainstorm ideas, experiments, hypotheses, and roadmaps. Collaborate to fully understand context, needs, vision, and outcomes. Ask smart questions. Set team goals. Define, document, monitor and forecast KPI. Perform root cause analyses on key metrics. Define requirements for developers to improve data instrumentation.
- **Understand our product and customers:** Analyze product features, journeys, and life cycles. Drive conversion, engagement, and efficiency across our funnel. Focus on activation, monetization, engagement, and retention. Identify customer characteristics and behaviors. Improve segmenting and cohorting.
- **Leverage a growth toolkit** : Define the models, paths, and loops of growth. Identify and prioritize opportunities for incremental improvements. Work in cycles of build, measure, and learn. Define, implement, and interpret A/B tests and other experiments. Educate stakeholders on statistical validity. 
- **Build a growth practice:** Scale success. Celebrate fast failure. Mature from one-off tactics to repeatable processes. Define best practices. Embrace not just quantitative, but qualitative; not just analytics, but creative thinking. Define requirements for data engineering to improve data, automation and analytics capabilities. 

### **What we're looking for:**

- **Six years total of analytics experience with three years in Product or Growth:** At least six years of analytics experience in total. At least three of those years in an analytics role specifically focused on product or growth.
- **Experience at a high-growth company:** Analytics experience with high-growth businesses. Ideally, those with well-defined, product-enabled funnels and complex, high-volume customer flows.
- **Technical education:** A bachelor’s degree in a technical or quantitative field (e.g., Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, Economics or Finance). A similar Master’s degree is preferred.
- **Proficiency across analytics tools:** Deep experience with analytical SQL queries (e.g., inner/left/right joins, CTEs, and window functions). Some experience with scripting within a notebook environment, preferably using Python, Pandas, and Jupyter. A desire to grow your modeling, machine-learning, and data-science skills. Familiarity with basic statistics (e.g., distributions, experiments, significance testing, and linear regression).  Experience with a major analytics/visualization platform (e.g., Tableau or Looker). 
- **Proficiency across growth tools:** Productive with growth tools. Specifically a product or events analytics platform (e.g., Google Analytics, Amplitude, Segment) and an AB testing tool (e.g., Optimizely, VWO). 

### **Bonus points!**

- Passion for data, discover, and problem-solving
- Curious; confident; open to questioning assumptions and being questioned.
- Effective communicator across technical and business audiences.  Able to manage stakeholder expectations and work with hands-on executives.
- Entrepreneurial; fast-moving; able to balance vision and execution; and not easily discouraged. Instinct for value, and focused on the incremental.

You can work remotely anywhere in North America. You also have the option to work out of our San Francisco, Denver, Boston or Toronto offices. CircleCI is a distributed company with team members across 50+ cities and 13 countries.

### **How To apply**

If you’re interested in joining the team at CircleCI, please send a resumé and a cover letter if you’d like to let us know describing what inspires you and why you think you are a good fit for the team. If you contribute to an open-source project, write a blog, or have a presence on the web (GitHub, Twitter, Stack, etc.) we would love to hear about it.

We know there’s no such thing as a “perfect" candidate. We’re all a work in progress and are growing new skills and capabilities all the time. CircleCI welcomes those who are enthusiastic about learning and evolving, so however you identify and whatever your background, if this looks like a role where you could do work that excites you, we hope you’ll apply.

### **About CircleCI **

CircleCI is the world’s largest shared continuous integration and continuous delivery (CI/CD) platform, and the central hub where code moves from idea to delivery. As one of the most-used DevOps tools that processes more than 1 million builds a day, CircleCI has unique access to data on how engineering teams work, and how their code runs. Companies like Spotify, Coinbase, Stitch Fix, and BuzzFeed use us to improve engineering team productivity, release better products, and get to market faster. 

Founded in 2011 and headquartered in downtown San Francisco with a global, remote workforce, CircleCI is venture-backed by IVP, Sapphire Ventures, Owl Rock, NextEquity Partners, Scale Venture Partners, Threshold Ventures, Baseline Ventures, Top Tier Capital Partners, Industry Ventures, Heavybit, and Harrison Metal Capital. Learn more at [https://circleci.com](https://circleci.com/).

CircleCI is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, sexual stereotypes, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law.

jobs.title: Senior Engineer - Web Development & Optimization
jobs.description:
CircleCI is looking for an experienced engineer who will lead the development of the circleci.com marketing website.


### About the Team

The Web Development & Optimization Team is responsible for developing and executing the web strategy for marketing pages on CircleCI.com. We work on integrated marketing campaigns, run A/B experiments, and optimize the web platform. Our team also works closely with our User Experience team to execute usability tests and design new web pages.


### Here are a few things you’ll get to do in this role

- Manage the circleci.com web platform
- Manage integrations with downstream systems
- Lead the development of the circleci.com marketing website, including the blog and documentation, working with our team of remote engineers to execute web projects.
- Support and optimize our multi-language capabilities
- Optimize the web platform for SEO, accessibility, and speed
- Design and develop cross-platform search capabilities using Algolia
- Support A/B testing, using Optimizely
- Ensure consistent tracking across the website by supporting our implementation of Segment and Google Analytics
- Ensure the stability of the platform through automated testing
- Own the DevOps toolchain, leveraging CircleCI to optimize our continuous integration and delivery capabilities


### About you

We’re looking for someone who enjoys collaboration, is curious and interested in learning, brings strong communication and teamwork skills, and helps others grow by sharing their expertise and encouraging best practices. If this sounds like you, here’s the additional experience we’re looking for:

- Experience writing, deploying, and operating high quality, well-tested, observable front-end code with some experience across the entire technology stack
- Demonstrable experience architecting applications and services - primarily those with user interfaces - using well-accepted design patterns to allow for iterative, autonomous development and future scaling
- The ability to articulate opinions about user interface and user experience design, an understanding of how your work impacts our users, and an eye for design and detail
- A deep appreciation and understanding of testing and its value in operating services at scale
- A desire to mentor teammates in an open, respectful, flexible, empathetic manner
- Experience in the day-to-day practices of continuous delivery and agile development
- Technologies: GitHub, Jekyll, HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Ruby, Rigor, Google Analytics, Google Tag Manager, Salesforce, Marketo, Amplitude, and Segment

If you’re interested in joining the team at CircleCI, please send a resumé with an optional cover letter if you’d like to let us know what inspires you and why you think you are a good fit for the team. If you contribute to an open-source project, write a blog, or have a presence on the web (GitHub, Twitter, Stack, etc.) we would love to hear about it.

We know there’s no such thing as an “ideal” candidate - we’re all a work in progress and are growing new skills and capabilities all the time. CircleCI welcomes those who are enthusiastic about learning and evolving, so however you identify and whatever your background, if this looks like a role where you could do work that excites you, we hope you’ll apply.


### Working remotely at CircleCI

We’re a distributed company with teammates across the world. For this role, we can support you working remotely anywhere in the United States or Canada.


### CircleCI Engineering Competency Matrix

This role equals level E3 on our Engineering Competency Matrix, our internal career growth system for engineers. These are the minimum expectations for this position, but we are always willing to discuss bringing people on at more senior positions when appropriate. Read our blog post about the competency matrix to learn more.

Further content that may be interesting for you:

- How to Get Hired at CircleCI
- A Letter to Future CircleCI Employees
- How We Uphold Our Inclusive Values as a Global Team


### About CircleCI

CircleCI is the best platform for software teams looking to rapidly build quality projects, at scale. Our intelligent continuous integration and delivery tools are simple yet powerful. Our aim is to provide the wisdom of a connected development ecosystem to every team member making technology decisions.

We run 12M+ builds a month on our platform for companies like Spotify, Kickstarter, Sony, and Coinbase. Over 25,000 organizations and 300,000 developers actively build, test, and deploy on CircleCI. We’ve raised $59.5M in venture capital from Industry Ventures, Top Tier Capital, Scale Venture Partners, DFJ, Harrison Metal Capital, and Baseline Ventures.

At CircleCI you will be part of a company that values trust, respect, diversity, and inclusion. We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. We strongly believe that diversity of experience, perspectives, and background will lead to a better environment for our employees and a better product for our users. We carefully consider every applicant who takes the time to apply.

We are a globally distributed team working towards the common goal of being the standard bearer for continuous integration and deployment software. We are looking for people who are interested in helping us shape software engineering best practices for the industry as a whole.

CircleCI is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, sexual stereotypes, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law.

jobs.title: Senior Engineering Manager
jobs.description:
CircleCI is looking for a seasoned Engineering Leader who brings experience building and leading teams and supporting Engineering Managers, and who’s excited to do this work in a fast-growing company. 

We are looking for a manager who is able to balance the development of their staff with the need to continuously improve our organization. In this role, you will challenge and support our teams with the individual in mind, and build a great culture with diversity, inclusion, action orientation, and openness as some of [our core values](https://circleci.com/careers/). 

As one of our Senior Engineering Managers, you will work across our entire Engineering organization (Product- and Platform Engineering) to support teams, managers, and drive larger organizational initiatives. You will initially start out in this role by supporting and building out our Growth teams, and take on additional responsibilities as our organization evolves. 

This is a full-time role in Canada, hired through our affiliate Continuous Labs .

**What You’ll Do: **

This role is a people management role focused on the development of engineers and delivery of business value. Your recurring tasks and responsibilities include:

- **Business value delivery:** Ensure continuous, incremental business value delivery and high-quality standards for your teams and help them utilize best practices to set and achieve their goals. Maintain high levels of transparency and efficiency, in collaboration with other development teams and Product Owners. Develop strategies and goals for your teams and the department in collaboration with our Product and Engineering leaders.
- **Learning and Development:** Attract, onboard, and retain diverse top talent. Develop the teams and people in your domain through coaching, mentoring, and management support. Conduct regular 1:1s (including skip-level), goal setting, and feedback conversations with engineering managers and engineers to ensure their well-being and team health, and support them in their learning and development. Continuously work to improve inclusion and belonging on your teams and throughout our organization.
- **Organizational work:** Help us continuously improve and grow and build further support structures for our teams by driving broader organizational development and cross-cutting initiatives with the rest of our engineering management team. 
- **Technical work:** Provide technical vision to your teams. Help grow the expertise of your team’s performance, reliability, resilience, scalability, maintainable architecture, and experimentation. We don’t expect you to write or review code on a regular basis, so this role may not be for you if you will deeply miss those things. 

### **What we're looking for:**

- **At least five years of direct management experience** building and leading software development or operations teams. Your experience includes hiring, as well as having both engineers and managers directly reporting to you and supporting them in their growth. You’ve supported managers directly for at least four years.
- At least 6 months of full-time experience working transparently and collaboratively with **distributed teams**.
- A **track record of using agile and lean methodologies** to help teams continuously deliver business value. 
- Exceptional **written and verbal communication skills** honed for both synchronous and asynchronous collaboration, and strong feedback skills. You are a **service-oriented leader** and strong collaborator, and you know what it takes to build strong, inclusive, productive teams and how to support managers effectively to help them grow. 
- You’re **comfortable with ambiguity** and turning it into just enough structure to call it a process (and evolving it further from there). You’ve scaled people and systems from non-existent to acceptable to scalable. You bring action orientation and a drive to continuously improve the teams you work with.

### **Who you’ll work with in this role: **

- Your peers and “first team” are our Senior Engineering Managers, and you’re a part of our distributed engineering management team. Your direct reports are Engineering Managers and Architects. 
- You report to our VP of Product Engineering and work very closely with our VP Platform, VP Growth, as well as with the Product Managers supporting the teams in your domain. 

### **Distributed teams at CircleCI**

We’re a distributed company with offices in San Francisco, Toronto, Japan, and teammates across the world. For this position, we are specifically looking for a manager in Canada, ideally Toronto. 

### **How we hire Engineering Managers**

Over the last year, we have made some critical shifts in our understanding of what we believe makes a great engineering manager at CircleCI, and learned a lot about our needs and values as an organization along the way. We wrote about this evolution, and what our hiring process for engineering managers looks like now: [What we've learned about hiring engineering managers](https://circleci.com/blog/what-we-ve-learned-about-hiring-engineering-managers/). 

You’ll find more information about Engineering Management roles at CircleCI on our blog:

- [What to expect as a remote CircleCI employee](https://circleci.com/blog/what-to-expect-as-a-remote-circleci-employee/)
- [How my distributed team communicates so no context is left behind](https://circleci.com/blog/how-my-distributed-team-communicates-so-no-context-is-left-behind/)

### **How to apply: **

Submit your application online via the Apply Now button.  

We know there’s no such thing as a “perfect” candidate - we’re all a work in progress and are growing new skills and capabilities all the time. CircleCI welcomes those who are enthusiastic about learning and evolving, so however you identify and whatever your background, if this looks like a role where you could do work that excites you, we hope you’ll apply.

### **About CircleCI**

CircleCI is the world’s largest shared continuous integration and continuous delivery (CI/CD) platform, and the central hub where code moves from idea to delivery. As one of the most-used DevOps tools that processes more than 1 million builds a day, CircleCI has unique access to data on how engineering teams work, and how their code runs. Companies like Spotify, Coinbase, Stitch Fix, and BuzzFeed use us to improve engineering team productivity, release better products, and get to market faster. 

CircleCI is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, sexual stereotypes, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law.

We are looking for a manager who is able to balance the development of their staff with the need to continuously improve our organization. In this role, you will challenge and support our teams with the individual in mind, and build a great culture with diversity, inclusion, action orientation, and openness as some of our core values.

As one of our Senior Engineering Managers, you will work across our entire Engineering organization (Product- and Platform Engineering) to support teams, managers, and drive larger organizational initiatives. You will initially start out in this role by supporting and building out our Growth teams, and take on additional responsibilities as our organization evolves.

This is a full-time role in Canada, hired through our affiliate Continuous Labs .

*What You’ll Do: *

This role is a people management role focused on the development of engineers and delivery of business value. Your recurring tasks and responsibilities include:

  • Business value delivery: Ensure continuous, incremental business value delivery and high-quality standards for your teams and help them utilize best practices to set and achieve their goals. Maintain high levels of transparency and efficiency, in collaboration with other development teams and Product Owners. Develop strategies and goals for your teams and the department in collaboration with our Product and Engineering leaders.
  • Learning and Development: Attract, onboard, and retain diverse top talent. Develop the teams and people in your domain through coaching, mentoring, and management support. Conduct regular 1:1s (including skip-level), goal setting, and feedback conversations with engineering managers and engineers to ensure their well-being and team health, and support them in their learning and development. Continuously work to improve inclusion and belonging on your teams and throughout our organization.
  • Organizational work: Help us continuously improve and grow and build further support structures for our teams by driving broader organizational development and cross-cutting initiatives with the rest of our engineering management team.
  • Technical work: Provide technical vision to your teams. Help grow the expertise of your team’s performance, reliability, resilience, scalability, maintainable architecture, and experimentation. We don’t expect you to write or review code on a regular basis, so this role may not be for you if you will deeply miss those things.
