jobs.title: Senior Product Manager - Server
jobs.description:
As the Senior Product Manager for our Server offering, you will be working as part Product Manager, part Program Manager. Our Server offering is our single-tenant, dedicated solution that is deployed by some of our largest customers on their own infrastructure who have unique security, compliance or regulatory needs. You will work directly with the Server engineering team to build key features that our Server customers require. You will also work closely with the rest of the Product Management and Engineering teams to ensure the needs of the Server customer are deeply ingrained into all of our new features being delivered. You will provide process expertise and technical guidance for the Product Management organization to deliver a best-of-breed single-tenant experience, deeply understanding our business drivers and key success metrics while regularly identifying, advocating for, and piloting process improvements.

### **Overview of Team: **

The Product Management team is responsible for the product strategy, roadmap, and execution. Because developers are our customers (and we’re a huge user of our own service), Product Management and Engineering work together closely to understand the needs of our users, and jointly define the product vision. We work in cross-functional teams, use data and user-research to drive our decision making, believe in delivering features quickly and continuously improving them, and love to talk to our users. We prioritize work that delivers the most impact, and is measurable and achievable.

### **What you’ll do:**

- Develop and articulate the product strategy for our single-tenant, Server offering, and effectively present and influence key stakeholders on the merits of the strategy. 
- Define MVP, prioritize features, build agreement and coordinate product schedules with a team of engineers and designers to ship top quality experiences to Server customers on a regular cadence
- Build and maintain our Server roadmap to delight our users while growing the business
- Define methods and metrics for measuring success and failure of our Server offering while ensuring the team is clear on their objectives, and constantly track performance
- Work directly with other product managers, designers and engineers to incorporate the needs of the Server customer with their features to ensure a cohesive and complete experience for our Server user.
- Identify and coordinate the interdependencies amongst the various product initiatives as it relates to the Server offering and its unique release cadence
- Work with Release Engineering to build, manage and improve our packaging and release process for our Server offering

### **What we're looking for:****  **

- 7+ years of product management experience, ideally in SaaS and / or packaged software
- Demonstrated ability to prioritize amongst competing opportunities, balancing customer needs with business priorities and the ability to articulate the rationale behind those decisions
- Strong use of analytics, user research and business cases to drive decisions and improve products
- Experience working with a variety of product management strategies and techniques, with a clear understanding of the pros and cons of each and how and when to apply them effectively
- Demonstrated ability in breaking down complex problems, developing strategies and plans to solve them, and effectively collaborating with teams to deliver solutions
- Exceptional written and oral communication skills
- Exceptional organizational and analytical skills
- Solid understanding of how software is built, tested and released to customers
- Experience working for an engineering-driven company a plus
- Startup experience a plus
- Understanding of Continuous Delivery concepts a plus

### **How to apply **

If you’re interested in joining the team at CircleCI, please send a resumé and cover letter describing what inspires you and why you think you are a good fit for the team. If you contribute to an open source project, write a blog, or have a presence on the web (GitHub, Twitter, Stack, etc.) we would love to hear about it.

We know there’s no such thing as a “perfect" candidate - we’re all a work in progress and are growing new skills and capabilities all the time. CircleCI welcomes those who are enthusiastic about learning and evolving, so however you identify and whatever your background, if this looks like a role where you could do work that excites you, we hope you’ll apply.

### **About CircleCI **

CircleCI is the world’s largest shared continuous integration and continuous delivery (CI/CD) platform, and the central hub where code moves from idea to delivery. As one of the most-used DevOps tools that processes more than 1 million builds a day, CircleCI has unique access to data on how engineering teams work, and how their code runs. Companies like Spotify, Coinbase, Stitch Fix, and BuzzFeed use us to improve engineering team productivity, release better products, and get to market faster. 

Founded in 2011 and headquartered in downtown San Francisco with a global, remote workforce, CircleCI is venture-backed by IVP, Sapphire Ventures, Owl Rock, NextEquity Partners, Scale Venture Partners, Threshold Ventures, Baseline Ventures, Top Tier Capital Partners, Industry Ventures, Heavybit, and Harrison Metal Capital. Learn more at [https://circleci.com](https://circleci.com/).

CircleCI is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, sexual stereotypes, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law.

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer  – Data Platform Engineering
jobs.description:
Data is at the very core of the decisions we make at CircleCI. We leverage our wealth of data to help build our product, understand our customers’ needs, and to help those customers make better engineering decisions themselves.

We’re looking for talented engineers to join the team serving as the stewards of that data - our Data Platform team. 

The team that you will be a part of is a talented group of engineers focused on delivering the tools, processes, and products used to get our data into the hands of teams across our organization and to our customers. You will be working on ingesting, curating, and publishing data to and from a variety of sources from our own product to the tools we use to do business.

This is a full-time role in Canada, hired through our affiliate Continuous Labs. 

### **What You’ll do on the Data Platform Engineering Team at CircleCI**

- **Build and automate pipelines for ingesting data from across our product and third-party tools**
- Curate and maintain core data sets that power our most critical business processes and decisions
- Implement tooling and libraries and build and maintain the infrastructure that support accessing our data in a variety of systems
- Help protect our customers’ data privacy through data governance and data security implementations like redaction and access control 
- Participate in an on-call rotation for our data platform services and infrastructure

### **Experience You Bring To This Role**

- 3+ years of professional experience building and debugging data-focused or infrastructure systems in a SaaS environment
- You write code that’s easily readable, testable, and maintainable, with an eye towards building in observability from the start.
- You’re comfortable with modern data engineering and data platform tools and programming languages. Technologies like Python, MongoDB, and Postgres don’t scare you, and you might have explored or used tools like Snowflake, Redshift, or BigQuery in previous roles.
- You’re good at managing the ambiguity of a small, rapidly-growing company: adjusting to changing priorities, making conscious tradeoffs when guidance is limited and information is incomplete, and instituting best practices from scratch when needed. 
- You can adopt a product-first mindset to build quality software that meets the customer’s needs and expectations.
- Prior data platform or data infrastructure experience preferred

### **We’re particularly interested in these habits and tendencies**

- You work transparently and collaboratively within a distributed team.
- You favor regular, incremental delivery of value over perfection.
- You’re excited about ensuring that all of our systems-software and human-scale smoothly.
- You strive for continuous learning and improvement for yourself and your team.

### **CircleCI Engineering Competency Matrix**

This role equals level E3 - on our[ Engineering Competency Matrix](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1F3xzmbdsMvfDZwZesvxcEIIBn2TmI4sg/view), our internal career growth system for engineers. These are the minimum expectation for this position, but we are always willing to discuss bringing people on at more senior positions when appropriate. Find more about the matrix in this[ blog post](https://circleci.com/blog/why-we-re-designed-our-engineering-career-paths-at-circleci/).

We know there’s no such thing as an “ideal” candidate - we’re all a work in progress and are growing new skills and capabilities all the time. CircleCI welcomes those who are enthusiastic about learning and evolving, so however you identify and whatever your background, if this looks like a role where you could do work that excites you, we hope you’ll apply.

### **Distributed teams at CircleCI**

We’re a distributed company with offices in San Francisco, Toronto, Japan, and teammates across the globe. We would be hiring you as a full-time employee based in Canada, with the option to work remotely.

### **How to apply **

Submit your application online via the Apply Now button. Please include a cover letter that describes why you're interested in working for CircleCI and summarize how your experience and career goals fit the qualifications for the position. 

We know there’s no such thing as a “perfect” candidate - we’re all a work in progress and are growing new skills and capabilities all the time. CircleCI welcomes those who are enthusiastic about learning and evolving, so however you identify and whatever your background, if this looks like a role where you could do work that excites you, we hope you’ll apply.

### **About CircleCI**

CircleCI is the world’s largest shared continuous integration and continuous delivery (CI/CD) platform, and the central hub where code moves from idea to delivery. As one of the most-used DevOps tools that processes more than 1 million builds a day, CircleCI has unique access to data on how engineering teams work, and how their code runs. Companies like Spotify, Coinbase, Stitch Fix, and BuzzFeed use us to improve engineering team productivity, release better products, and get to market faster. 

CircleCI is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, sexual stereotypes, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law.

Some content from [our blog](https://circleci.com/blog) that may be interesting to you: 

- [How to Get Hired at CircleCI](https://circleci.com/blog/how-to-get-hired-at-circleci/)
- [A Letter to Future CircleCI Employees](https://circleci.com/blog/a-letter-to-future-circleci-employees/)
- [How We Uphold Our Inclusive Values as a Global Team](https://circleci.com/blog/how-we-uphold-our-inclusive-values-distributed-team/)

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer - Ecosystems
jobs.description:
At CircleCI, we enable thousands of developers to do better work every day. We're looking for a senior software engineer to help us support and grow the systems to make that possible.

As a member of the Ecosystem team, you’ll focus on expanding the use of our platform through private and shared extensions. You’ll also work on [Orbs](https://circleci.com/docs/2.0/using-orbs/), APIs, and our [CLI](https://circleci.com/docs/2.0/local-cli/#overview). You’ll do all of that through collaboration with talented colleagues distributed across North America and western Europe. 

This is a full-time role in Canada, hired through our affiliate Continuous Labs and requires work during normal business hours in the Eastern time zone plus regular participation in our on-call support rotation. If you’re in the Toronto area, we hope you’ll work in our local office for some of your time.

### **What You’ll Do:**

- Design and build new features, simplify existing services, and scale our systems while we rapidly grow and evolve.
- Write plenty of sustainable, testable, high-quality, high-performance code.
- Nurture a culture of observability and monitoring: use operational data to help your team improve the stability and performance of our systems.
- Partner with members of a cross-functional team and other stakeholders to set the direction of our platform and product: learn about our business problems, explore solutions, weigh design tradeoffs, create effective user stories, and prioritize them to deliver maximum value.

### **What we're looking for**** :**

- You have 3+ years of professional experience building and debugging distributed systems in production environments.
- You write code that’s easily readable, testable, and maintainable, with an eye towards building in observability from the start.
- You’re comfortable using functional programming paradigms. (We use Clojure, but it’s fine if you haven’t yet.)   
- You’re good at managing the ambiguity of a small, rapidly-growing company: adjusting to changing priorities, making conscious tradeoffs when guidance is limited and information is incomplete, and instituting best practices from scratch when needed. 

### **Bonus Points!**

- You work transparently and collaboratively within a distributed team.
- You favor regular, incremental delivery of value over perfection.
- You’re excited about ensuring that *all* of our systems--software *and* human--scale smoothly.
- You strive for continuous learning and improvement for yourself and your team.

### **CircleCI Engineering Competency Matrix**

This role equals level E3 on our [Engineering Competency Matrix](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1F3xzmbdsMvfDZwZesvxcEIIBn2TmI4sg/view), our internal career growth system for engineers. These are the minimum expectations for this position, but we are always willing to discuss bringing people on at more senior positions when appropriate. Find more about the matrix in this [blog post](https://circleci.com/blog/why-we-re-designed-our-engineering-career-paths-at-circleci/).

### **How to apply: **

Submit your application online via the Apply Now button. Please include a cover letter that describes why you're interested in working for CircleCI and summarize how your experience and career goals fit the qualifications for the position. 

We know there’s no such thing as a “perfect” candidate - we’re all a work in progress and are growing new skills and capabilities all the time. jobs.descriptionHtml:
At CircleCI, we enable thousands of developers to do better work every day. We're looking for a senior software engineer to help us support and grow the systems to make that possible.

As a member of the Ecosystem team, you’ll focus on expanding the use of our platform through private and shared extensions. You’ll also work on Orbs, APIs, and our CLI. You’ll do all of that through collaboration with talented colleagues distributed across North America and western Europe.

This is a full-time role in Canada, hired through our affiliate Continuous Labs and requires work during normal business hours in the Eastern time zone plus regular participation in our on-call support rotation. If you’re in the Toronto area, we hope you’ll work in our local office for some of your time.

What You’ll Do:

  • Design and build new features, simplify existing services, and scale our systems while we rapidly grow and evolve.
  • Write plenty of sustainable, testable, high-quality, high-performance code.
  • Nurture a culture of observability and monitoring: use operational data to help your team improve the stability and performance of our systems.
  • Partner with members of a cross-functional team and other stakeholders to set the direction of our platform and product: learn about our business problems, explore solutions, weigh design tradeoffs, create effective user stories, and prioritize them to deliver maximum value.

What we're looking for** :**

  • You have 3+ years of professional experience building and debugging distributed systems in production environments.
  • You write code that’s easily readable, testable, and maintainable, with an eye towards building in observability from the start.
  • You’re comfortable using functional programming paradigms. (We use Clojure, but it’s fine if you haven’t yet.)
  • You’re good at managing the ambiguity of a small, rapidly-growing company: adjusting to changing priorities, making conscious tradeoffs when guidance is limited and information is incomplete, and instituting best practices from scratch when needed.

Bonus Points!

  • You work transparently and collaboratively within a distributed team.
  • You favor regular, incremental delivery of value over perfection.
  • You’re excited about ensuring that all of our systems--software and human--scale smoothly.
  • You strive for continuous learning and improvement for yourself and your team.

CircleCI Engineering Competency Matrix

This role equals level E3 on our Engineering Competency Matrix, our internal career growth system for engineers. These are the minimum expectations for this position, but we are always willing to discuss bringing people on at more senior positions when appropriate. Find more about the matrix in this blog post.

jobs.title: Software Engineer – Server Team
jobs.description:
CircleCI seeks a Software Engineer who is eager to build a product that empowers thousands of developers to ship quality code faster, every single day. In this role, you will contribute to the Server team within our Platform Engineering group, working adjacent to SRE and Security teams. This team is charged with supporting, developing, maintaining, and improving our on premise product. 

As a Software Engineer on the Server team, you will work alongside development, operations, marketing, and sales to maintain product integrity and deliver new functionality. You will manage escalations, maintain and extend the platform, add tooling for observability, as well as participate in agile team processes.

This crucial position affords the right candidate many interesting and challenging opportunities to play a key role in the growth and maturity of the team. The engineer stepping into this role will have a significant impact on the stability and functionality of our on premise product.

### **What you'll do:**

- Manage engineering escalations from support for our on premise customers.
- Design and build new features.
- Write sustainable, testable, high-quality, high-performance code.
- Participating in and contributing to the improvement of rotating on-call duties, including incident management.
- Partner with members of a cross-functional team and other stakeholders to set the direction of our platform and product: learn about our business problems, explore solutions, weigh design tradeoffs, create effective user stories, and prioritize them to deliver maximum value.

### **What we're looking for:**

- Experience building and debugging distributed systems in production environments.
- Understanding of Docker or evolving container management platforms like Kubernetes or Mesos
- Experience with cloud services and virtualization, e.g. AWS, GCP, etc.
- Experience managing container-based architectures, including orchestration, service-discovery, monitoring, and debugging
- You write code that’s easily readable, testable, and maintainable.
- You’re comfortable using functional programming paradigms. (We use Clojure, but it’s fine if you haven’t yet.)   
- You’re good at managing the ambiguity of a small, rapidly-growing company: adjusting to changing priorities, making conscious tradeoffs when guidance is limited and information is incomplete, and instituting best practices from scratch when needed. 

### We’re particularly interested in these habits and tendencies:

- You care deeply about the experience and satisfaction of users (internal and external)
- You work transparently and collaboratively within a distributed team.
- You favor regular, incremental delivery of value over perfection.
- You strive for continuous learning and improvement for yourself and your team.

### **CircleCI Engineering Competency Matrix**

This role equals level E3 on our [Engineering Competency Matrix](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1F3xzmbdsMvfDZwZesvxcEIIBn2TmI4sg/view), our internal career growth system for engineers. These are the minimum expectation for this position, but we are always willing to discuss bringing people on at more senior positions when appropriate. Find more about the matrix in this [blog post](https://circleci.com/blog/why-we-re-designed-our-engineering-career-paths-at-circleci/).

### **How to apply: **

Submit your application online via the Apply Now button. Please include a cover letter that describes why you're interested in working for CircleCI and summarize how your experience and career goals fit the qualifications for the position. 

We know there’s no such thing as a “perfect” candidate - we’re all a work in progress and are growing new skills and capabilities all the time. CircleCI welcomes those who are enthusiastic about learning and evolving, so however you identify and whatever your background, if this looks like a role where you could do work that excites you, we hope you’ll apply.

Companies like Spotify, Coinbase, Stitch Fix, and BuzzFeed use us to improve engineering team productivity, release better products, and get to market faster.

jobs.title: Solutions Engineer
jobs.description:
**As a Solutions Engineer at CircleCI** , you will be the customer’s trusted technical advisor throughout the sales process. You’ll provide hands-on support for cloud-based and single tenant deployments and product guidance with CircleCI’s largest customers.

This job will be performed in CircleCIs London office, with occasional travel.

### **About Sales Solutions at CircleCI**

Our Solutions Engineers have a strong understanding of the developer community and are able to confidently communicate with and provide first class support to developers and DevOps leads.

### **What you’ll do: **

- Serve as the technical support in mid-market and enterprise opportunities across the EMEA region.
- Collaborate with Account Executives to identify and uncover customer business goals, needs, and pains, and work to show how CircleCI can address them.
- Support customer trials, providing advice and technical support along the way.
- Prove the technical feasibility of the CircleCI platform to highly technical and developer audiences.
- Stay on top of industry news, technology products, platforms, new CircleCI features, and partners to ensure you and your team provide and maintain a deep industry and ecosystem expertise.
- Identify areas of potential improvement in our sales efforts, and then work to improve them. This could be high level strategy, daily tactical efforts, or down in the weeds of creating documentation or how to videos.
- Partner closely with our customer success teams to ensure continuity of an amazing customer experience - for life.
- Collaborate closely with Product and Engineering teams to help influence product roadmap based on market/customer requirements.
- Provide technical responses to RFPs and RFIs.

### **What we’re looking for: **

- World class presentation skills. You feel comfortable leading presentations and demos of our platform to groups, both technical and non-technical, in-person and virtually.
- Work with customers directly to debug common errors without involving an engineer.
- You can tie business problems to technical solutions and understand technology value propositions.
- Demonstrated and proven capacity to quickly absorb new concepts and technologies.
- You have spent a decent amount of time using and scripting *nix.
- You’re familiar with basic networking concepts, i.e. TCP/IP fundamentals.
- You know how to work with Git in general and ideally GitHub or Bitbucket in particular.
- You’ve thrown together an app or two in a high-level programming language.
- You have working knowledge of cloud computing and exposure to one of the major vendors (AWS, GCP, Azure).
- You believe that the best way for all to succeed is to honestly discuss product and company abilities and limitations with customers. We do not oversell at CircleCI.

### **Bonus points!**

- Experience with build, test, and deployment automation.
- Knowledge of Docker or Linux containers in general.
- Experience with popular web app frameworks and/or mobile app development (iOS, Android).
- Exposure to Hashicorp technologies (Terraform, Nomad, etc).
- Experience using and automating a major IaaS like AWS, GCP, or Azure.
- Familiarity deploying and debugging distributed systems.

****Not all skills required. This is a growth role that will expose you to mentors and additional pathways.**

### **How to apply**

If you’re interested in joining the team at CircleCI, please send a resumé and cover letter describing what inspires you and why you think you are a good fit for the team. If you contribute to an open-source project, write a blog, or have a presence on the web (Twitter, Quora, Linkedin, etc.) we would love to hear about it.

We know there’s no such thing as a “perfect" candidate - we’re all a work in progress and are growing new skills and capabilities all the time. CircleCI welcomes those who are enthusiastic about learning and evolving, so however you identify and whatever your background, if this looks like a role where you could do work that excites you, we hope you’ll apply.

### **About CircleCI **

CircleCI is the world’s largest shared continuous integration and continuous delivery (CI/CD) platform, and the central hub where code moves from idea to delivery. As one of the most-used DevOps tools that processes more than 1 million builds a day, CircleCI has unique access to data on how engineering teams work, and how their code runs. Companies like Spotify, Coinbase, Stitch Fix, and BuzzFeed use us to improve engineering team productivity, release better products, and get to market faster.

Founded in 2011 and headquartered in downtown San Francisco with a global, remote workforce, CircleCI is venture-backed by IVP, Sapphire Ventures, Owl Rock, NextEquity Partners, Scale Venture Partners, Threshold Ventures, Baseline Ventures, Top Tier Capital Partners, Industry Ventures, Heavybit, and Harrison Metal Capital. Learn more at [https://circleci.com](https://circleci.com/).

CircleCI is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, sexual stereotypes, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law.

jobs.title: Staff Product Manager
jobs.description:
As a Staff Product Manager, you will define and ship successful, meaningful products that help thousands of developers deliver better applications to their users faster. You will provide expertise and technical guidance for the Product Management organization, deeply understanding our business drivers and key success metrics while regularly identifying, advocating for, and piloting process improvements for the Product organization as a whole.

### **Overview of Team: **

The Product Management team is responsible for the product strategy, roadmap, and execution. Because developers are our customers (and we’re a huge user of our own service), Product Management and Engineering work together closely to understand the needs of our users, and jointly define the product vision. We work in cross-functional teams, use data and user-research to drive our decision making, believe in delivering features quickly and continuously improving them, and love to talk to our users. We prioritize work that delivers the most impact, and is measurable and achievable.

### **What you’ll do:**

- Develop and articulate the product strategy for a key part of the CircleCI experience, and effectively present and influence key stakeholders on the merits of the strategy. 
- Define MVP, prioritize features, build agreement and coordinate product schedules with a team of engineers and designers to ship top quality experiences to users for a core part of the CircleCI experience
- Build and maintain a roadmap to delight our users while growing the business
- Integrate usability studies, user research, market analysis and community feedback into product requirements to ensure the product satisfies user needs as well as wants while informing product decisions with quantitative data on user behavior and experimentation 
- Define methods and metrics for measuring success and failure while ensuring the team is clear on their objectives, and constantly track performance
- Coordinate with other product managers, designers, and engineers to ensure a cohesive overall user experience.
- Identify, recommend and advocate for opportunities to improve the product management process across the organization. 
- Share best practices, serve as a mentor to other team members, and contribute to the development of the Product Management organization as a whole.

### **What we're looking for:****  **

- 10+ years of product management experience, ideally in SaaS or related space
- Demonstrated ability to prioritize amongst competing opportunities, balancing customer needs with business priorities and the ability to articulate the rationale behind those decisions
- Strong use of analytics, user research and business cases to drive decisions and improve products
- Experience working with a variety of product management strategies and techniques, with a clear understanding of the pros and cons of each and how and when to apply them effectively
- Demonstrated ability in breaking down complex problems, developing strategies and plans to solve them, and effectively collaborating with teams to deliver solutions
- Experience mentoring other product managers
- Exceptional written and oral communication skills
- Exceptional organizational and analytical skills
- Solid understanding of how software is built, tested and released to customers
- Experience working for an engineering-driven company a plus
- Startup experience a plus
- Understanding of Continuous Delivery concepts a plus

### **How To Apply:**

If you’re interested in joining the team at CircleCI, please send a resumé and cover letter describing what inspires you and why you think you are a good fit for the team. If you contribute to an open-source project, write a blog, or have a presence on the web (Twitter, Quora, Linkedin, etc.) we would love to hear about it.

We know there’s no such thing as a “perfect" candidate - we’re all a work in progress and are growing new skills and capabilities all the time. CircleCI welcomes those who are enthusiastic about learning and evolving, so however you identify and whatever your background, if this looks like a role where you could do work that excites you, we hope you’ll apply.

### **About CircleCI**

CircleCI is the world’s largest shared continuous integration and continuous delivery (CI/CD) platform, and the central hub where code moves from idea to delivery. As one of the most-used DevOps tools that processes more than 1 million builds a day, CircleCI has unique access to data on how engineering teams work, and how their code runs. Companies like Spotify, Coinbase, Stitch Fix, and BuzzFeed use us to improve engineering team productivity, release better products, and get to market faster. 

Founded in 2011 and headquartered in downtown San Francisco with a global, remote workforce, CircleCI is venture-backed by IVP, Sapphire Ventures, Owl Rock, NextEquity Partners, Scale Venture Partners, Threshold Ventures, Baseline Ventures, Top Tier Capital Partners, Industry Ventures, Heavybit, and Harrison Metal Capital. Learn more at [https://circleci.com](https://circleci.com/).

CircleCI is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, sexual stereotypes, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. jobs.title: Staff Software Engineer - Backend
jobs.description:
### **About the Role**

CircleCI seeks an experienced engineer who is excited to help shape the future of our internal development platform. You’ll join a distributed team in an engineering organization that values collaboration, trust, and learning. We’re growing fast and looking for folks to join our mission: enabling thousands of developers to do better work every single day.

#### The Backplane team’s goal is to provide an exceptional internal developer experience which enables our product development teams to execute more quickly, consistently and reliably. You will have direct impact in the following ways:

- Developing new libraries, tools and services for use by development teams
- Collaborating with teams to identify enhancements to our internal developer experience
- Collaborating with teams to adopt or migrate to new technologies
- Writing high-quality documentation for internal technologies and best practices
- Fostering a culture of observability and monitoring; helping teams leverage tools to gain better insight into the (mis)behavior of their systems in production.
- Collaborating across teams to evolve our architecture.
- Writing sustainable, high-quality, high-performance code.

### **About you**

Do you love collaboration and teamwork? Are you eager to learn new things and help others learn, too? Are you a strong communicator in both synchronous and asynchronous mediums? If so, here’s the additional qualities we’re looking for:

- 3+ years of backend development experience with micro-services and distributed systems.
- An interest in the complete product development process (requirements gathering, user interviews, design, implementation, testing, documentation, etc).
- A focus on delivering high-quality code through strong testing practices.
- Some knowledge of Clojure or interest in learning and working in the language.
- Must be willing to work Eastern or GMT hours

We know there’s no such thing as a "perfect” candidate - we’re all a work in progress and are growing new skills and capabilities all the time. CircleCI welcomes those who are enthusiastic about learning and evolving, so however you identify and whatever your background, if this looks like a role where you could do work that excites you, we hope you’ll apply.

### **CircleCI Engineering Competency Matrix **

The[ Engineering Competency Matrix](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1F3xzmbdsMvfDZwZesvxcEIIBn2TmI4sg/view) is our internal career growth system for engineers. This position is level E4. If you are not sure this is you, we encourage you to apply. Find more about the matrix in this [blog post](https://circleci.com/blog/why-we-re-designed-our-engineering-career-paths-at-circleci/).

### **How to apply: **

Submit your application online via the Apply Now button. Please include a cover letter that describes why you're interested in working for CircleCI and summarize how your experience and career goals fit the qualifications for the position. 

We know there’s no such thing as a “perfect” candidate - we’re all a work in progress and are growing new skills and capabilities all the time. CircleCI welcomes those who are enthusiastic about learning and evolving, so however you identify and whatever your background, if this looks like a role where you could do work that excites you, we hope you’ll apply.

### **About CircleCI**

CircleCI is the world’s largest shared continuous integration and continuous delivery (CI/CD) platform, and the central hub where code moves from idea to delivery. As one of the most-used DevOps tools that processes more than 1 million builds a day, CircleCI has unique access to data on how engineering teams work, and how their code runs. Companies like Spotify, Coinbase, Stitch Fix, and BuzzFeed use us to improve engineering team productivity, release better products, and get to market faster. 

CircleCI is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, sexual stereotypes, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law.

Some content from [our blog](https://circleci.com/blog) that may be interesting to you: 

- [How to Get Hired at CircleCI](https://circleci.com/blog/how-to-get-hired-at-circleci/)
- [A Letter to Future CircleCI Employees](https://circleci.com/blog/a-letter-to-future-circleci-employees/)
- [How We Uphold Our Inclusive Values as a Global Team](https://circleci.com/blog/how-we-uphold-our-inclusive-values-distributed-team/)

jobs.title: Technical Community Manager
jobs.description:
**As the Technical Community Manager at CircleCI** , your main goal is to build connections with current and future CircleCI developers and help inspire and educate them around DevOps principles, namely CI/CD. This involves leading both the strategy and execution, and is a big opportunity for someone with a technical background who thrives on building scalable communities around the world. The right person for this role has experience building and measuring community programs (online, in-person, and via social media), and is looking for an opportunity to originate and grow this program at CircleCI. The Technical Community Manager reports directly to the Head of Developer Relations and Community.

This position can be based remotely from the United States or Canada.

### **About Developer Relations and Community at CircleCI**

The Developer Relations and Community team is responsible for connecting with, inspiring, and educating developers (our users) on the CircleCI platform in particular and DevOps principles in general. Our DevRel team works closely with multiple areas of the company, from Marketing to Engineering to Product, to name a few, as well as building relationships with 3rd parties and partners.

### **What you'll do: **

- Develop a full-scale, outbound community program focused around engagement, inspiration, and education of the CircleCI brand
- Manage the CircleCI community engagement strategy, including measurable goals and KPIs
- Create and manage an ambassador program, with the goal of creating a self-sustaining, global network of influencers
- Increase the number of developers that regularly interact with CircleCI by providing an active community
- Own the vision and strategy for interacting with, and growing, our Developer Community
- Own community interaction and engagement on Discuss (forum), Twitter, StackOverflow, Medium, HackerNews, and beyond.  
- Define the ways in which community members can provide feedback and input to CircleCI
- Collaborate with Product, Customer Engineering, Business Development, Brand Marketing teams, as well as Events to ensure coordinated participation and a consistent narrative
- Work with Community & Partner Engineering Team to expand the number of active and influential open source projects using CircleCI
- Collaborate with the Developer Advocate role at international, national, and local events
- Create processes to capture, analyze, leverage and share customer insights to stakeholders in the Company
- Collaborate with marketing and sales to launch new services, features and enhancements effectively through the community
- Support the Content Managers in identification and creation of new content (blog posts, videos, etc.) to the community on a regular basis to help drive the conversation, with the goal of turning active community members into advocates. Also help source Guest Writers

### **What we're looking for:**

- You are obsessed with making developers happy
- You have 3+ years of experience leading community advocacy programs
- You are very familiar with the open source community
- You are analytical and data driven in your approach to building and nurturing communities
- You have experience facilitating sensitive and complex community situations with humility, empathy, judgment, tact, and humor
- You share our values, and work in accordance with those values
- You are a technology enthusiast at heart. Love all things related to engineering and adopting new and exciting technologies. You think like a developer
- You exhibit Interpersonal skills by effectively communicating, building rapport, and relating to others at all levels, in both written and verbal forms
- You have experience working with software engineering teams (in product, design, or engineering) with at least 3+ years of community development
- You have a solid understanding of relevant technology and tools including CI/CD, APIs, cloud solutions, and programming languages
- You might have a background in SaaS, real-time communications, or enterprise

### **Bonus points!**

- You were a full-time developer in a previous life, but you prefer to work with the developer community to improve experience and support through education
- You have experience representing a company, project, or community at events, conferences, meetups, etc. and giving talks
- You have an existing network from a diverse set of communities and social media platforms

### **How to apply**

If you’re interested in joining the team at CircleCI, please send a resumé and cover letter describing what inspires you and why you think you are a good fit for the team. If you contribute to an open-source project, write a blog, or have a presence on the web (Twitter, Quora, Linkedin, etc.) we would love to hear about it.

We know there’s no such thing as a “perfect" candidate - we’re all a work in progress and are growing new skills and capabilities all the time. CircleCI welcomes those who are enthusiastic about learning and evolving, so however you identify and whatever your background, if this looks like a role where you could do work that excites you, we hope you’ll apply.

### **About CircleCI**

CircleCI is the world’s largest shared continuous integration and continuous delivery (CI/CD) platform, and the central hub where code moves from idea to delivery. As one of the most-used DevOps tools that processes more than 1 million builds a day, CircleCI has unique access to data on how engineering teams work, and how their code runs. Companies like Spotify, Coinbase, Stitch Fix, and BuzzFeed use us to improve engineering team productivity, release better products, and get to market faster. 

Founded in 2011 and headquartered in downtown San Francisco with a global, remote workforce, CircleCI is venture-backed by IVP, Sapphire Ventures, Owl Rock, NextEquity Partners, Scale Venture Partners, Threshold Ventures, Baseline Ventures, Top Tier Capital Partners, Industry Ventures, Heavybit, and Harrison Metal Capital. Learn more at [https://circleci.com](https://circleci.com).

CircleCI is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, sexual stereotypes, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law.

jobs.title: Technical Product Marketing Manager
jobs.description:
**As a Technical Product Marketing Manager at CircleCI** , you will be an integral part of optimizing our technical product marketing practices to help demonstrate our competitive advantage to a highly intelligent and technical audience. To be successful in this role, you will need to brush up on all things CI/CD and collaborate cross functionally to communicate CircleCI’s value to drive adoption and use of our platform. This position is perfect for someone who is looking to grow their career in product marketing within a fast-growing start-up environment.

### **About Product Marketing at CircleCI**

As part of the Marketing team, Product Marketing owns the development and execution of our feature releases and go-to-market strategy, product positioning and value proposition development, buyer personas, customer insights, competitive analysis, and sales & field enablement content and programs. We work in cross-functional teams, love to talk to customers, use data and user research to drive our decision making, believe in delivering quickly, measuring our results, and constantly refining our approach. We prioritize work that delivers the most impact across customer-facing touchpoints and is measurable and achievable.

### **What you’ll do:**

- Become a product and domain expert for CircleCI:

  - Collaborate with product managers to understand the ins-and-outs of our feature set and capabilities. Act as a technical advisor for key marketing initiatives.
  - Drive and own go-to-market (GTM) activity for minor release efforts and test new approaches and channels for increasing awareness and engagement.
  - Scope upcoming feature opportunities for our full scale GTM efforts. We’ll look to you to distill and communicate why our CI/CD capabilities are relevant and competitive in the DevOps landscape. 
- Work across teams:

  - Partner closely with our Internal Technical Trainer to create, refine, and evolve our technical content and training programs for customer-facing teams.
  - Partner with customer engineers to identify core principle differences, strengths, weaknesses, and opportunities across our competitive landscape. Develop compelling content and consult in competitive programs.
  - Drive product feature advocacy engagements across our product and community/dev advocate teams.
  - Collaborate with product and content teams to create and manage a compelling set of technical content and tools to drive feature awareness and customer success. Examples of your work should include but not limited to landing pages, battlecards, info sheets, integration guides, videos, FAQs, tutorials, etc.
- Maintain feedback loops and track success metrics:

  - Provide feedback to refine and evolve our audience personas which inform the positioning, messaging, and value proposition of our platform and upcoming features.
  - Define measurable success. Own reporting and analysis for those success metrics. Drive for results and use data to measure progress.

### **What we’re looking for:**

- 3+ years of work experience in product marketing, product management, engineering, sales enablement, or experience marketing a technical product. 
- Fast learner with the ability to explain and distill information of technical concepts to a non-technical audience.
- Experience in a B2B technology company (preferably in the DevOps space or related fields)
- Strong attention to detail and a capacity to set priorities and work within deadlines.
- Sharp writing skills, excellent storyteller and communicator. Please be able to provide some writing samples.
- Passion for our mission, our technology, and our innovative approach
- Work out of the San Francisco office; limited travel required

### **Bonus points!**

  - Familiarity with the software developer community and ecosystem
  - Developer marketing experience a huge plus
  - Software development experience or familiarity with CI/CD
  - Graphic design and/or video production skills

### **How to apply**

We know there’s no such thing as a “perfect" candidate - we’re all a work in progress and are growing new skills and capabilities all the time. CircleCI welcomes those who are enthusiastic about learning and evolving, so however you identify and whatever your background, if this looks like a role where you could do work that excites you, we hope you’ll apply.

If you’re interested in joining the team at CircleCI, please send a resumé and cover letter describing what inspires you and why you think you are a good fit for the team. If you contribute to an open source project, write a blog, or have a presence on the web (GitHub, Twitter, Stack, etc.) we would love to hear about it.

### **About CircleCI **

CircleCI is the world’s largest shared continuous integration and continuous delivery (CI/CD) platform, and the central hub where code moves from idea to delivery. As one of the most-used DevOps tools that processes more than 1 million builds a day, CircleCI has unique access to data on how engineering teams work, and how their code runs. Companies like Spotify, Coinbase, Stitch Fix, and BuzzFeed use us to improve engineering team productivity, release better products, and get to market faster.

Founded in 2011 and headquartered in downtown San Francisco with a global, remote workforce, CircleCI is venture-backed by IVP, Sapphire Ventures, Owl Rock, NextEquity Partners, Scale Venture Partners, Threshold Ventures, Baseline Ventures, Top Tier Capital Partners, Industry Ventures, Heavybit, and Harrison Metal Capital. Learn more at https://circleci.com.

CircleCI is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, sexual stereotypes, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law.
